column5: this guy is trying to look like the guy in aplumma's avatar

If I have learned anything about nature is don't put your hand in anything you don't know what is in there.  Worse is putting your hand somewhere you know  might hold a freekin 25 pound Snapping Turtle, or a 25 pound Catfish, or anything not naturally found in downtown Hamilton. That's just looking for it. I learned a long time ago DO NOT look for lost golf balls in, near or some God  awful Jungle type fauna. I happened across a nest of baby Rattle Snakes in a Myrtle Beach sand trap looking for a 50 cent golf ball. Moma was none too happy. My pals didn't think I could still move that fast. Buddy once nearly stepped on a 12 foot Gadder looking for his ball in FLA, never again. I once put one of those little lizards in the glove box in Fla. and asked the same pal to hand me a Kleenex. He screamed like a 12 year old little girl at a Beatle concert.
This is one of my favorite ones. "play stupid games win stupid prizes"
Art, not many branches in that red necks family tree.
those turtle probably knew what they were doing...looks like they have survived a few winters already

Just this past labour day I was cleaning a few fish on the dock, dipped my hands and knife in the water to get some slime off and up swims a 20 pound snapper right under my hands.  Had to check my appendages after that...
Tell bro his posture is all wrong.  I would be checking more than my appendages, my Depends perhaps.
Not sure what they were actually doing? Why are they bothering those snapping turtles? Lucky they were able to keep all their digits!
